page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: CHANGING LANDSCAPE A lot of the farms in our area have changed from dairy farms to complete arable farms. The reason for this is mainly cost. It apparently is expensive to comply with all the standard for dairying and machinery needed for milking is very costly. Dairying is also very time consuming for the farmer. Our area grows mostly winter or spring barley and a new crop to the area called oil seed rape has been introduced within the last two years. The growth of this crop has doubled in Fife in the last year. This adds a lovely splash of yellow colour over the area in May/June. Some beef cattle are kept but mostly cows with suckling calves. The calves are fattened and sent to be slaughtered.
